P.title: Will Freedom House report that internet freedom has declined every year until 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if for each year until 2025, inclusive, Freedom House reports more countries with a decrease in their internet freedom scores than with an increase

Q.title: Will the UK have a Labour Prime Minister on January 1, 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if the UK Prime Minister on January 1, 2030 is a member of the Labour Party.
Otherwise, the question resolves negatively.
Show More

P_or_Q.title: Will Freedom House report that internet freedom has declined every year until 2025 or will the UK have a Labour Prime Minister on January 1, 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if either of the following conditions is met: a.) For each year until 2025, inclusive, Freedom House reports more countries with a decrease in their internet freedom scores than with an increase, OR b.) The UK Prime Minister on January 1, 2030 is a member of the Labour Party.
Otherwise, the question resolves negatively.

P.title: Will Freedom House report that internet freedom has declined every year until 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if for each year until 2025, inclusive, Freedom House reports more countries with a decrease in their internet freedom scores than with an increase

metadata.background_info: The Freedom on the Net report is an annual report on internet freedom worldwide, produced by Freedom House. It tracks changes in internet regulation across 65 countries. As of the 2020 edition, it claimed that freedom had been on the decline (operationalised as more countries' scores decreasing than increasing) for ten years in a row, with 26 countries' scores worsening and 22 improving in 2020. This question asks if this pattern of decline will persist for the next five years.

Q.title: Will the UK have a Labour Prime Minister on January 1, 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if the UK Prime Minister on January 1, 2030 is a member of the Labour Party.
Otherwise, the question resolves negatively.
Show More

metadata.background_info:
Related Question on Metaculus:
Will the UK have a Conservative Prime Minister on January 1, 2030?
The Labour Party is a centre-left political party in the United Kingdom that has been described as an alliance of social democrats, democratic socialists and trade unionists. The party's platform emphasises greater state intervention, social justice and strengthening workers' rights. As of 2020, it was last in power from 1997 to 2010.

reasons: Political shifts in major countries like the UK could influence global internet freedom policies. A Labour Prime Minister might advocate for stronger internet regulations or freedoms, which could impact global trends.

Both questions involve political and social trends, which can be interconnected. For example, a global trend towards more authoritarian governance could lead to both a decline in internet freedom and a shift in political power in the UK.
relevance.conclusion: There are plausible reasons to consider the logical combination of these questions, as political and social trends can be interconnected.
